title: How to get valid  p2p peers in Rinkeby testnet?
body:
My Rinkeby node always couldn't found any peers

start  command :
```
geth --rinkeby --rpcvhosts '*' --rpc --rpcapi web3,eth,net,db,personal,admin,txpool --ipcpath /data1/eth_testnet_data/geth.ipc  --datadir /data1/eth_testnet_data --rpcaddr 0.0.0.0 --rpcport 18545 --port 40303   --bootnodes=enode://a24ac7c5484ef4ed0c5eb2d36620ba4e4aa13b8c84684e1b4aab0cebea2ae45cb4d375b77eab56516d34bfbd3c1a833fc51296ff084b770b94fb9028c4d25ccf@52.169.42.101:30303
```


logs as below


I'd start by dropping the `--bootnodes` flag. Rinkeby is hard coded into the client, so it should work without it (also it has 2 more bootnodes available).
@karalabe   I  restart geth without `--bootnodes`.   The number of peer nodes has always been 0, but sometimes the peers are found, so the block height cannot always be updated in time.
Hi, guys. How do you solve the problem for Unavailable modules in HTTP API list     unavailable=[db] available="[admin debug web3 eth txpool personal clique miner net]" ?

I started it with docker, and that's the problem

```
ERROR[04-26|13:01:39.798] Unavailable modules in HTTP API list     unavailable=[db] available="[admin debug web3 eth txpool personal clique miner net shh]"
```
command is  docker run -d --name ethTest -v /data/ercData/test:/root -p 8545:8545 -p 30303:30303 ethereum/client-go --rpcaddr 0.0.0.0 --rpc --rpcapi web3,eth,net,db,personal --rpccorsdomain "*" --nousb --dev,  Is there any good solution?

> Hi, guys. How do you solve the problem for Unavailable modules in HTTP API list unavailable=[db] available="[admin debug web3 eth txpool personal clique miner net]" ?

appoint command 	--rpcapi="web3,eth,net,db,personal"

> I started it with docker, and that's the problem
> 
> ```
> ERROR[04-26|13:01:39.798] Unavailable modules in HTTP API list     unavailable=[db] available="[admin debug web3 eth txpool personal clique miner net shh]"
> ```
> 
> command is docker run -d --name ethTest -v /data/ercData/test:/root -p 8545:8545 -p 30303:30303 ethereum/client-go --rpcaddr 0.0.0.0 --rpc --rpcapi web3,eth,net,db,personal --rpccorsdomain "*" --nousb --dev, Is there any good solution?

I got the same problem, any solutions?
I mean, it pretty much says it in the line. There's no such thing as `db` RPC API namespace. Why would you add that to the list in `--rpcapi web3,eth,net,db,personal`?

geth --identity "PRMS" --rpc --rpcport "8280" --rpccorsdomain "*" --rpcapi "db,eth,net,web3" --datadir "E:\Saad\FYP\privateNetwork" --port "30303" --nodiscover --networkid 1999 console

problem:
 Unavailable modules in HTTP API list     unavailable=[db] available="[admin debug web3 eth txpool personal ethash miner net]"
I face the same issue any solution?
Did you even read my comment above yours?

> @karalabe I restart geth without --bootnodes. The number of peer nodes has always been 0, but sometimes the peers are found, so the block height cannot always be updated in time.

I'd consider the original issue closed. At the time this was written, we probably did not have DNS discovery on Rinkeby, so the discovery situation should have improved since then. Might still be crappy though - depends on how many are interested in running nodes on a testnet, which varies over time.
